intro: Hoffmannseggia pumilio, commonly known as the small stonecress, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Hoffmannseggia pumilio is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with mild winters and warm, dry summers.
